subject: Design
title: The Rosetta Stone: Design for Translation
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Rosetta Stone: Design for Translation usable.

hook.text: A slab of stone from 196 BCE held the same decree in three scripts. That layout was intentional.

buildup.text: Egyptian priests designed the Rosetta Stone so Greek rulers and locals could both read it.

discovery.text: Placing hieroglyphs, Demotic, and Greek side by side was an early exercise in multilingual design.

twist.text: Centuries later, that design choice let Champollion crack hieroglyphs entirely.

climax.text: A deliberate layout decision in 196 BCE unlocked an entire lost civilization.

punchline.text: Good design outlasts the people who made it.

quiz.question: Why was the Rosetta Stone inscribed in three scripts?
options: So different language groups could read it
